page.title: 12Law and Order in NW Derby
page.content: There are two major police stations. The Divisional Headquarters on Full Street, which also accommodates the Central Sub-divisional HQ, and the West Sub-divisioonal HQ on St. Mary's Gate. There are also local police offices at Kingsway and Park Farm. Derby has a community policing policy which puts more officers on the 'beat' patrolling a specific area. A Woman Police Constable came to School and explained that her job was to 'save life and protect property'. The crime detection rate in the County was 54.3% in 1984. The Magistrates Courts deal with juvenile matters at Bold Lane and adult cases at Derwent Street. There is also a Crown Court Office on Queen's Street.
